bio: Welcome to @apple. Tag #ShotoniPhone to take part.

posts.description: “To me, photography means happiness and connection. And sometimes therapy.”
Showcase 10:
"Working with a cosmic event as a light source was something I knew I couldn't pass up."
“When children are at play, they enter into a reality that adults can never fully appreciate.”
“It was summer, the last days. But I know that even as the weather changes and winter comes, this building will remain bright and colorful. Like summer forever.”
A walk through Seoul,
“Traveling by train is a photographer’s paradise. Absolutely no shortage of new subjects and situations.”
“I also take photos without my son in them, they’re just never as good.”
“Just another day in Morocco.”
“It was at this moment, with nothing left to lose, that I suddenly felt complete.”
With support from Apple. “All you have to do is simply stop and wait for everyday life to happen.”
“There is nothing better than being amongst nature.”

“Blending in.”
"Documentary photography is about opening your heart and surrendering control."
“It’s gotta feel pretty amazing to be 8 years old at 30,000 feet.”
“I love capturing moments where the human body interacts with nature in interesting ways. This was one of those moments.”

“I’ve dreamed my entire life of seeing icebergs in Antarctica. It was worth it.”
“Ultimately, I want my work to evoke good vibes.”
“I think my son’s yellow raincoat is exactly what this wall needed.”

“I find Arabian horses to be just as unpredictable as they are beautiful.”
“I have long been trying to isolate the unique architectural shapes of my adoptive city of San Francisco. Lately, I’ve begun experimenting with a more colorful evolution of this technique.”
“When you see a moment of pure elation in a location such as this, you have to capture it.”
“My favorite view atop Victoria Peak, overlooking the skyscrapers of Hong Kong.”
“Whether he’s climbing up a tree in the park or balancing on a unicycle in the Hollywood Hills, Jax makes me a happier and healthier person.”

"The magic of underwater is unparalleled.”
“The more I travel, the more culturally fluent I become and the more I can empathize. Really what it comes down to is building empathy, with all the cultures and all the people in this world.”
“I was walking through the park one day when I happened upon this woman in yellow sitting amongst a sea of red.”
“You can show up at a rodeo in south New Jersey or one in Texas and things will be pretty much be the same, other than the cowboys having different accents.”
“I was thinking about those old film noir movies when the situation just presented itself.”
“I will do almost anything to get the shot I envision, short of blatantly breaking the law or hurting others. Or myself.”
“Down in the cracks of the Earth, water forms these incredible shapes over the course of thousands of years, waiting for you to visit them.”
“And nature always wins.”
“Light will always find its way over darkness.”
"Since childhood, we as Mexicans are taught to celebrate the return of our dearly departed. On the Day of the Dead, we are happy to know that our loved ones come back every year to be with us.”
“Thank you, Mother Nature.”
“I’m not really good at words so photography is my way of telling stories.  It is my language.”

“So do I.”

“It’s not every day that you see someone hanging outside your window on the 43rd floor.”

“I will never forget this moment.”

"I’ve always been drawn to leading lines and symmetry. When I first got into photography, I figured shooting architecture was a good place to start.”
"My work is an effort to document microorganisms as the complex living creatures they are. Fun fact: These microorganisms are all New Yorkers.”
"Giant ice cubes from the Glacier Grey.”

With support from Apple. “There’s a purity to Songkran that feels overlooked now. I prefer when people aren’t the main focus, but instead, the focus is water. In this way, I feel the sincerity of the spirit of Songkran.”
“Yes, Chicago.”
“Desert ships.”
“The Tokyu Plaza Omotesando is such a famous place that finding a new perspective can be difficult. Here is a low-angle shot of my sister taking it all in.”
“There’s nothing better than when you finally get to see something with your own eyes to believe it.”
“I like finding interesting moments in places where most people don’t pay much attention. It helps that I like the color green.”
"Five days of camping and soaking in hot springs, just my dog and I.”
"I do believe in vibes."
“The night is still young.”
